editorialSummary.text: Basic high-rise lodging with an Italian restaurant, a 24-hour fitness room & free Wi-Fi.

originalText.text: The location was great and the rooms were clean just a little bit small. On our first night in the hotel, the water stopped working in our room completely. There was no running water in the sink, toilet, and shower. We tried to call the front desk but the phone did not work. Prior to this, we asked for towels about 2 times and did not receive any. I went downstairs to talk to the front desk and was told that someone was gonna check on us. I asked for towels again for the third time and didn’t get any.The maintenance worker came and let us know what the situation was. We went to bed that night without being able to use the toilet, was our faces or our hands. We were prepared to relocate to another hotel in the morning if the water was not back on. Around 5 am, the water began running again but it was brown. We let it run hoping it would clear up and it slowly started getting more pale but not quite clear. I decided to ask for towels a 4th time around and bumped into the maintenance man. He was great and told me that the water should clear up soon. We were glad to hear this news because we were beginning to use the water that hadn’t cleared up all the way to wash our faces and take showers. The water began working but we couldn’t reach management since the issue occurred. It seemed that every method we tried to get in contact with management lead to them avoiding us. A member of my party was pregnant and this was very unsafe for her as well as the rest of us. We do not blame the hotel for the water running out but this was poorly handled. It seemed as though the only helpful person at the hotel was the maintenance man. We were getting the runaround and this is completely upsetting. We were also told that we couldn’t get our deposit back because of a so called “mess” that we left in the room. We made sure to discard of any trash and not leaving anything on the floor so this is an absurd accusation.

originalText.text:
I would first want to note that the general staff we came in contact with was really great! Friendly and very helpful! The manager on duty, not so much. They were not the friendliest and seemed as if we were a bother to them with every interaction. The hotel is in a great location and made for an easy sightseeing trip with a child.
Rooms were ok and what you could expect from a budget hotel in midtown. The website also mentioned a special rate for hotel guests parking at a nearby garage, but it turned out to just be the regular garage rate. Overall not the best but not the worst, decent and doable for a one night stay, but likely wouldn’t book again if I had another option.

Overall not the best but not the worst, decent and doable for a one night stay, but likely wouldn’t book again if I had another option.

originalText.text: Good location and the rooms were pretty clean, but they were pretty small and cramped. I almost had to stand in the shower to close the door to the bathroom. The mattresses were also quite firm and the auto-off on the ac/heating unit wasn't working so, when I first got into the room, it felt like a blast furnace. Also- and don't know if this was a problem more with the TV or cable- but the sound and picture kept freezing up, cutting out, or not working entirely. Staff were fine, but didn't seem to know that much about what was in the area or recommend a restaurant when the one in the hotel was closed (separate issue).

originalText.text:
I enjoyed my stay here! Rooms have been recently remodeled and construction ended.  Everything was clean and the room looked great. Rooms were small but it’s Manhattan. Location was great and central with lots of restaurant and coffee shops around (key since I was there for work). Would definitely stay there again both for work and for myself. I’m not expecting a resort when staying at any Holiday Inn and this exceeded my expectations

Sammy was amazing during my stay. Super personable and overall a fantastic person to talk to. The other staff I encountered were friendly as well. Even if another place ends up cheaper next time I’m in NYC my experience with the staff will make me stay here again

originalText.text: DO NOT STAY HERE! Seemed nice and clean at first but this was not the case. Phone, tv, and water at one point did not work. After a long day of traveling on night one of being there, we were ready to shower and bed down. When we turned the water on, nothing came out. We checked the sink and that was the same situation. We were unable to call the front desk we tried calling on our personal phones and no one picked up. When we approached the front desk, the female associate asked how she could help us and then proceeded to turn around as if nothing was said. It took other people asking another associate for us to find out why we had no water. They told us they would call us when it was resolved. Our phone did not work so we sat and waited for a while before it started working. We notified them of what wasn’t working and they offered no compensation, explanation, or help. When it did start back, the water was BROWN! We booked a city view room and did not receive that. This was not a super cheap room. Just be aware of what you might be in for.
